column1: back of a length, angling across to off stump, and backward point dives left to stop the attempted steer to third man. A good bit of bounce, so he took his bottom hand off while playing the ball, in order to keep it down

ooh, maybe a hint of inswing on a middle-stumpish line, pitched right up. Looks to drive through mid-off, possibly, and ends up squeezing the ball away between his legs and to the right of the square-leg umpire and it simply runs all the way to the boundary
full on off stump, driven to mid-off

full on middle and leg, a bit of inswing, gets his front leg out of the way and pushes towards mid-off. Afridi falls over in his follow-through, but he looks okay to continue once he gets back on his feet
back of a length, slanting across and finishing in a tight channel close to off stump. Left alone
shot. Not that short or wide, but the ball sits up nicely and he steps back and across to cut fiercely to the right of backward point
full outside off, gets forward and drives to cover point
quickish, angling into off stump, punched back to the bowler off the front foot
a touch back of a length, steps a long way back and across to work it into the leg side from outside off stump. No real turn at all
this one does turn, and it bounces too. Was looking to make room and punch through the covers, and it zips past his outside edge and bounces over the stumps
quickish, angling into leg stump, clipped into the square leg region
back of a length on off stump, makes room to cut and backward point dives right to stop the ball
shortish, slanting away from off stump, may have stopped on the batsman a little. Malan swivels through an attempted pull and misses. Went under his bat
shot. Length ball, slanting to off stump, makes room while shuffling out of his crease and flat-bats it over mid-off

shot! This one was pitched further up, and on leg stump, in an attempt to deny him hitting room, but he steps away from the line again and drives it back over the bowler's head, finishing with a high left elbow as the ball soars over the rope
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes and punches into the point region

this is stunning from Malan. Steps away towards the leg side again and Afridi slants a shortish ball away from him, but he manages to swat it away with a horizontal bat and hit high and far over mid-on
back of a length, angling away from off stump, opens his bat face and stabs to backward point
floated up, pitched outside off, Markram shuffles across and tries to sweep but misses and it hits the pad
quicker through the air, Markram goes back and stabs this between point and cover. They run through
quickish again, pitched outside off and turning away, Malan pokes at it but it spins past his outside edge
flatter through the air, on the pads, turned away to mid on area for a single
shortish, slower through the air, punched straight to cover

gone! This is given lbw, but Malan reviews it immediately. This is flattish, fast on the stumps, angled in and not turning. Malan gets a lot of bat on it, but it seems to have flicked his back pad first. And sure enough, the replay shows that it grazed the pad before his bat came down and hit it into the offside. This is not looking good for Malan. It's hit him right in front of middle and is going on to clatter into the stumps. Original decision remains. End of a promising innings. SA lose a review too.
length ball wide of off stump, Markram stands tall and punches that wide of mid off for a single
short ball, angled slightly across Lubbe, who rocks back in a flash and pulls it waay in front of square over the the top of the infield for four. Early shot of confidence
length ball, outside off. Lubbe can only get that as far as the legside infield

slower ball, 122kph, and Hasan has fooled him with that. This is fullish, outside off stump. Lubbe is trying to hit this down the ground but is through the shot way too early. Ends up spooning a catch to cover, who doesn't have a lot of work to do to get under that one.
fullish ball on off stump, driven just wide of mid off, who rushes across to cut off the single
full outside off stump again, driven wide of mid off again, but they can scamper the single this time, as the fielder has more work to do
full on leg stump. Worked away towards deep midwicket for a single.
On middle and leg this time. Worked away easily for another run.
flat short outside off. rocks back and cuts it away past backward point.
Fullis on the toes. Whipped to backward square. no run.
Moves outside leg and crashes it through the offside.
Full on the toes, Turned around to short fine leg for a single.
Back of a length close to off stump, punched to the right of deep point
Back of a length again, angling into off stump and cramping him for room. Defended towards midwicket
slower ball on off stump, gets on the front foot and whips it away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, stops on him slightly and he uses his wrists to work it into the wide mid-on region
lovely shot. It's a touch overpitched from Hasan, outside off, and Markram drives powerfully to the right of extra-cover
hits a hard length on off stump, punched quietly down the ground towards long-on
full-toss to start, outside off, and opens his bat face and slices a drive between point and backward point. May have been a touch unintentional. Seemed to be aiming through extra-cover
four more! this time Qadir drops a little short, and he rocks back to slap it away to the left of the diving sweeper cover fielder
loopy full-toss on off stump, inside-edges an attempted sweep into his back leg. Was the attempted wrong'un
tossed up full on off stump, big stride forward to whip towards long-on
full on off stump again, clipped into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
quickish length ball on middle and leg, clipped quietly into the midwicket region
wow. Super shot from Klaasen there. Short, just outside off stump, and he simply stands there and pulls it away, flat and all the way over the midwicket boundary
back of a length on off stump, again he just stands there and pulls, no real footwork but he's in a great position nonetheless, along the ground this time to the left of deep square leg

back of a length, and this ball sticks in the turf just outside off. Markram is looking to punch into the covers, ends up checking himself, and still somehow the ball pings off his bat and runs away to the cover boundary
slower ball on off stump, clipped back to the bowler with a turn of the wrists

another slower ball, but it's right in Markram's slot outside off. Gets a good stride forward, but with his left foot going towards the leg side to create hitting room, and from there a free swing of his arms sends the ball soaring over the long-on boundary
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
shot. Short ball, sliding on towards middle and leg. Makes a lot of room and carves it away between point and backward point
stays back to a flat length ball outside off, and punches crisply through cover point to bring up a 30-ball half-century. Well played!
flat, skids through on off stump and hits Klaasen on the thigh as he looks to work it into the leg side
wrong'un, but it's pitched far too short, and Klaasen opens up at the hips and pulls powerfully to send another ball flying through the thin atmosphere and over the boundary at square leg
tossed up full on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
wrong'un, spinning from middle to leg. Gets forward and plays an inside-out push into the covers

he can do even better. Quickish slider that follows Markram who's looking to make room for the back-foot punch through the covers, and cramps him for room. Only manages a thick outside edge that Rizwan does well to grab after a bit of a juggle
nicely bowled. Slows it down on off stump, and manages to get a bit of grip and turn. Stretches out and pushes quietly into the cover point region
again he flights it, this time a bit fuller on middle and leg, and Klaasen clips it away through midwicket to bring up South Africa's 100
some turn again from a leg-stump line. Presses forward and pushes into the covers. Can't go too hard at it when it's turning like that, from a good length
fires it in quicker on the pads, goes right back to punch to the right of long-on
sharp turn again. Quickish on leg stump, and he comes forward and looks to work it with the angle. Ends up sending a leading edge rolling towards backward point
short, wide, and Klaasen slaps it away in trademark style. Just stands there and lashes it away to the left of cover
straighter, goes deep in his crease and punches gently into the mid-on region, and there's no one inside the circle in that direction so they can pick up two. Smart batting
short, sits up again on an off-stump line, and that's really quick hands from Klaasen through the short-arm pull, once again he clears the boundary, this time just in front of square
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and opens his bat face to stab to backward point
shortish, a bit of width, and he slaps it away, but this time cover point is back on the boundary to restrict K;laasen to a single
shortish outside off, chopped down to third man
short, spinning away from off stump, flat-batted to long-off

tossed up outside off, and it lands too full, and when you do that, it doesn't matter if you have the sweeper back. Driven powerfully to beat extra-cover to his left, and the sweeper has too much distance to cover to his right
short on off stump, pulled down the ground to long-on
flat slider on off stump, looks to flat-bat it through the covers but is slightly cramped for room and the ball rolls towards the extra-cover fielder without too much pace

top-edge for six. That can happen at this altitude. Flat legbreak on leg stump, and he looks to sweep and gets just enough bat on it and manages to place it just about well enough to beat deep backward square leg to his right
quickish on leg stump, goes back and works it away through midwicket
length ball, stays low. Pulled to deep backward square
length ball, outside off. Slashes it, but mistimed. Goes to third man
good length, outside off. Shuffling across, and paddles a six over fine leg! Innovative
good length, wider outside off. Slapped to deep point
dropped! Off his fingertips. Tried to clear mid off, but Hasan cannot hold on. Tough chance!
fullish, on off. Muscles a slog to deep midwicket
full on off. The drive is mistimed to deep midwicket
fullish, on off. Hammered through the off side, but cover dives to intercept
fullish, on middle and leg. Slower ball. Hammered to deep midwicket
short ball attempted, and he pulls behind square. Shouts of 'catch it' but it beats the man in the deep!
works it leg side, and comes back for the second run. His fifty
full and wide. Pokes at it, but too late into a square drive. Through to the keeper
full toss, outside off. Slices it over point and the ball rolls away. Deep point cleans up
yorker length, on off. But does enough to clean it down to long on
in the blockhole, and clubbed to long off this time
yorker length, outside leg. Hits the foot and rolls away to square leg. He's down, in a bit of pain
clipped to deep midwicket. Slowly enough for him to come back for the second
overpitched, hit on the full to Babar at cover
nearly a yorker from Hasan. Dug back to the bowler
tries to play the paddle but shuffling across. But not timed well, and a comfortable catch at short fine leg! Done in by the offcutter
slower ball again. Tap and run to cover
around the stumps, and the full toss is driven to deep point
full toss, knee high, on middle. Mistimed drive to mid off
good length, angling in from around the stumps. Pushed to wide long on, and they want two, but settle for one in the end. Top over, and the end of a great spell
fullish, just outside off. Struck to deep point
full from around the stumps. Around middle and leg. Smartly clipped to fine leg, where Rauf has to put a dive in to stop the four, but has he been successful? Yes he has
in the slot on middle. Tries to slog it, but mistimed to deep backward square
fullish, on off. Driven to mid off
full toss, from around the stumps. Slaps it over cover, but doesn't have the legs to go all the way. Taken in the deep!
full, on off. Hit to wide long on. Excellent over
low full toss thumped to mid off
yorker length, on off. Guided to point

yorker length, on leg. Misses the flick, hits the leg and they appeal for lbw! Given out but they take the review. This is out, hits his back leg, in front of the stumps. No bat either. Would've crashed into leg
low full toss, nearly a yorker. Just outside off. Dug away to point
full on middle. Pushed to deep point
thumped to mid off ut just a single. Another great Rauf over
low full toss, from around the stumps. Slapped to cover
low full toss, tailing into the stumps. Looks to slog. Inside edged to fine leg
cheeky! Full on the stumps, but he shuffles across, and reverse paddles a boundary over short third man!
full and wide. Crashed to deep extra cover
good length, on off. Tries to slog it over deep midwicket but gets no connection. Through to the keeper
full on off, and that's been smacked over wide long on! South Africa finish on 188.
full on middle stump, whipped away towards deep square leg
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off

ooh, dropped, but a difficult return catch for Linde. Back of a length on off stump, stops on Rizwan, and his checked punch ends up over Linde's head to his left. Leaping effort, gets his fingertips to it, but can't grab on
a touch short for the sweep, misses and the ball hits him on the bicep of his right arm
tossed up fuller on off stump, driven to long-off
slider on off stump, goes back and jabs into the point region
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, no room and he can only clip it gently to midwicket
short, a bit of width, but he has a man back at deep cover point and he keeps this punch down to two with a sprint to his right
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and stabs to short third man
bam, terrific shot from Rizwan. Length ball, angling in towards off stump, and he clears his front leg and simply whips this over wide long-on
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently towards backward point
length ball, down the leg side. Rizwan can't connect with the attempted hoick behind square
back of a length, angling across the stumps, lets it come on and dabs to the left of backward point
appeal for lbw as Rizwan misses the flick, but it pitched outside leg stump quite clearly
shortish on leg stump, steps away from leg stump to make swinging room and flat-bats to the right of mid-on, who makes an excellent diving save. Lubbe the fielder
short again, on off stump, and he opens up at the hip and swats it away to the right of midwicket
short, wide, but the ball keeps a little low as Babar looks to slap it through the covers. Bottom edge through to the keeper, on the bounce
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed down the ground to the left of mid-on
shot! Poor ball to start from Magala, short and angling down leg, and Babar simply whips it away in the air, to the left of short fine leg. And he's overstepped too.
hard length, angling into middle stump, at around hip height. Difficult ball to pull, but Babar tries, and only manages to send it rolling towards midwicket off the high part of the bat
back of a length close to off stump, pulled on the bounce to midwicket
back of a length, angling into leg stump. Looks to work it away, only manages a bit of thigh pad into the square-leg region

slower ball angling towards leg stump, not a terrible delivery, but Rizwan manages to put it away with a bit of luck. Steps across to sweep, only gets some glove on it, and manages to bisect the keeper and short fine leg
shot! Length ball angling into off stump, and Rizwan has absolutely hammered that. Clears his front leg, and achieves a lot of bat speed with a whip of his wrists to hit it over midwicket

in the blockhole, follows Rizwan's premeditated movement away from leg stump, and that's desperately unlucky for Magala. Looks to flick, gets a bottom edge, and gets it into the gap to the right of short fine leg. Twenty off the over, but I'd say he only bowled one really bad ball
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, steps across and dabs towards backward point
more lucky runs for Pakistan. Length ball on middle stump. Clears his front leg and looks to whip over the leg side, the angle finds his outside edge and the ball loops away over backward point
back of a length and extra bounce with the angle away from off stump. Looks to stand still and punch through the covers, and the ball beats his edge
another lbw appeal as Babar misses the flick, but once again the ball pitched outside leg

shortish, wide, but that can be a good ball in T20 if you have the sweeper out on the off side. Babar times this slapped drive well, but he picks out Williams, who only has a couple of steps to move to his right to catch the ball
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, angling into off stump, steps across and tucks it away through square leg
length ball outside off stump, flat-batted hard but straight to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and dabs into the cover point region
short, angling away from the stumps, looks like the slower bouncer, and Fakhar makes room and carves it up and over the covers. No one back on the off side to stop this
back of a length, tucks him up by bowling at his legs. Looks to whip it away but only manages a bit of thigh pad into the short fine leg region
quickish length ball on off stump, lets it come and dabs gently into the cover point region

superb shot. Quickish, angling across and straightening a touch outside off, but maybe a couple of inches on the short side, and Fakhar chops it away and picks the gap between backward point and short third man
once again a touch short, and a bit of width, and Fakhar goes deep in his crease and cuts with precision to beat backward point to his left
looks for the same shot but not too much width this time, finds the man at backward point
tossed up now on middle and leg, and Fakhar is really turning it on now. Clears his front leg for the slog-sweep over square leg
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and punches to deep point
back of a length, spins away from off stump, punched to backward point
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
flat, spins into the pads, can't quite get bat onto his flick, which rolls a short distance into the leg side off his pad. Klaasen sprints quickly to prevent the single
shot. Tossed up on leg stump, and he clears his front leg and slog-sweep to find the gap to the right of deep midwicket
flat, spinning in from just outside off, goes back and works it into the midwicket region
shortish, wide, slapped to extra-cover
starts another over with a short ball down the leg side, but this time Rizwan can't get any bat onto this hoick
full, close to off stump, driven firmly back and there's an appeal as Magala deflects the ball onto the stumps in his follow-through. Was Zaman in his crease? Yup, he's grounded his back just in time
full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
short, wide, too wide for Fakhar to attempt a shot. Looks like the attempted slower ball gone wrong, the ball bounces a couple more times before reaching the keeper
back of a length fairly close to off stump, lets it come to him and guides to backward point
full on off stump, driven to long-on
slower ball, full and down the leg side, swept away to deep square leg
short ball climbing steeply over off stump. Looks to lean away and ramp it fine, but can't make contact
tossed up on off stump, and again Rizwan picks that gap with the slog-sweep, sending the man at deep midwicket on a futile sprint-and-dive routine to his right
tossed up outside off, spinning back in, presses forward and pushes gently into the covers, calling Fakhar through for a quick single. He has to dive to make his ground in time at the striker's end
flighted ball angling into leg stump, swept to deep square leg
down the track and he can't quite reach the pitch of this ball pitching outside leg. Doesn't turn as much as he expects. Looks to flick, gets a leading edge into the cover point region

bam. Another slog-sweep, another six. Right up in Fakhar's arc, and he opens up at the hips to make himself swinging room before he sinks onto his back knee. Clears the boundary just in front of square

gone, excellent work at the boundary! And well bowled by Shamsi too. Makes him fetch this slog-sweep from wide outside off, against the turn, and he can't quite hit it off the meat of his bat. Janneman Malan takes the catch while backtracking at the midwicket boundary, and then he flicks it up before crossing the line and then jumps back into the field of play and completes the catch comfortably. Excellent awareness and footwork
full on middle. Comes down the wicket and drives to mid off
deft touch as he uses the turn of this length ball to play it fine past short third man!
good length, outside off. Cut late, behind point. Fielder in the deep runs across the boundary and puts in a dive, but can't parry the ball back into play
full on middle. Worked to deep backward square leg
good length, outside off. Drags this in front of square, and gets it between deep midwicket and long on! Sharp work
full, on off. Presses forward and pushes it to cover
fullish, on middle. Makes room and flays it to deep midwicket
wrong'un length ball on middle, and turning across his bat. Nearly takes off stump en route to the keeper. Rizwan had no clue
full on off. Down on one knee, and swept well but Williams dives to stop the four. Nonetheless, another Rizwan fifty
good length, outside off. Turning in. Late cut to point
full, wider outside off. Drags a slog to deep midwicket
good length, outside off. Uppishly driven, manages to clear cover, but doesn't have the power to reach the boundary
slower ball, length delivery angling in. Lobbed towards midwicket
full, on off. Pushed to deep midwicket with soft hands. Wants two, but they settle for one

full outside off. Throws his bat at this drive, and they hesitate for the second run. Williams in the deep throws it at the wrong end! Could've been run out at either end, these batsmen, but the keeper's end had lesser chance of the dismissal.
full on middle. Driven to wide long on
good length ball on middle. Going down leg, and although it goes down the leg side wide not given. That's because if the batsman hadn't shuffled across, it was hitting his thighs

beautifully done and the professor falls for 13. Shamsi brings out the phone celebration with his shoe in his ear as this googly stumps Hafeez. Length ball on middle, turning away as he tries to come down the wicket to smash it over the leg side. No connection, and Klaasen whips the bails off
length ballm, worked to the leg side for a single
full on leg. Hits his pad, and rolls leg side. They scurry across for one
tossed up, and he comes down the wicket before hammering a drive over the non-striker! Long off throws himself across but can't intercept
fullish, outside off. turning away. Tapped to the off side for one
length ball on middle. Turning into leg. Mistimed sweep to the leg side
full on leg, and going further down. Rizwan came down the ground to slap it behind square but makes no connection
good length, on middle, and angling down leg again
good length, outside off. Pulled to deep midwicket
slower ball, overpitched outside off, and he creams a drive over cover! Stylish
good length, outside off. Wants to run it down fine but can't make any connection
smart cricket! Good length, outside off. Opens his stance and cuts it over point for four more
good length, on off. Swings hard, gets some connection to deep midwicket
fullish, outside off. Nudged to deep midwicket, and enough time to pinch the second run

full toss, on leg, and he misses the flick. Hits him above the knee roll, and the umpire says out! They are chatting to review and Haider reviews. No bat involved, and that's crashing into middle and leg. A cameo ends too soon

two in two! Good length, just outside off. Tries to run it fine, but it's taken a thin edge to Klaasen! On a hattrick. Tried to play it in the gap at the vacant third man region, pays the price for it
good length, on off. Clipped off his hips, in the air, and into the boundary at deep midwicket
good length, outside off. Works it to long on for one
yorker length, on middle and leg. Dug away to the leg side
length ball angling across. Tries to cut, but can't find the gap
full and wide, from around off stump. Tries to drive over cover, but takes an outside edge past the keeper instead
full, outside off again. Dug away to point
full toss on middle. He makes room and whips it behind to deep backward square
full on off. Drilled to long on
full toss, just outside off. Slogged to deep midwicket
full, just outside off. Tees off like a golfer and gets it beyond long on! They got 14
full toss to start the over. Around off stump, and he drives it over mid off to start the over with a boundary
full toss again. On off, and he clubs it over deep midwicket! Sixteen runs off the last three balls now
another one! On his toes, and whipped behind square, for four to deep backward square
full toss again, but this time the whip finds deep midwicket
full outside off. Driven hard, to long off
good length, outside off and angling further away. Premeditated attempt at at a paddle shot, but the line forces him to change his mind. Ends up under-edging a confused shot to Klaasen
wow. Full-toss, just about waist-high, slanting away from off stump, and Faheem slaps it away to the left of deep point
four more, and this is getting easy for Pakistan. Full, leg-stumpish, and that's not good when you have fine leg in the circle. Flicked away, and the ball beats him easily to his right
in the blockhole, on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
length ball angling across to off stump, looked like the offcutter. Not short enough to pull, gets a bottom-edge down to short fine leg
low full-toss on leg stump, clipped away towards deep square leg
excellent finish to the over. Off-stump yorker, driven down the ground to long-on
full on middle. Can't get under it, so mistimes the shot. Taken in the deep? No, dropped! Long on runs it, dives forward to take the catch, but the ball pops out.
does the job next ball though! Full, on middle, and gets it under the swinging bat. Middle stump gone
full outside off. Gets inside the ball's line and looks to clear long off. Instead it takes a thick edge, and goes to the third man boundary
full just outside off. Tries to clear long off, but slices it. Cover runs behind to take the catch. Falls just beyond Hendricks
yorker length, on off. Manages to squeeze it to deep midwicket for two. And oh dear, the bowler fluffs the throw and they take an overthrow for the third to seal the win. Pakistan win by four wickets
